to envy the virtuous and talented (idiom)
heaven is jealous of heroic genius (idiom); the great have great hardship to contend with/those whom the Gods love die young

to be green with envy (neologism c. 2009)

sentences.english: And it is also noted, that love and envy do make a man pine, which other affections do not, because they are not so continual.
sentences.chinese: 这是因为没有什么能比爱与妒更具有持久的消耗力。

sentences.english: Ge hundred urgent for flow, million as the beautiful flowers envy.
sentences.chinese: 百舸急争流，万任群芳妒。

sentences.english: The spring term Qunfang jealousy, grind to dust scattered into the mud, only the fragrant as ever.
sentences.chinese: 春，一任群芳妒，零落成泥碾作尘，只有香如故。

sentences.english: This calamity was caused by evil spirits, not because the gods were jealous.
sentences.chinese: 固鬼蜮之为灾，岂神灵之有妒。
